Class HybridFileSelectButton

      A variant of the HybridSettingsButton, this allows a user to select a file from the Android filesystem, and displays whether or not said value has been set yet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HybridFileSelectButton

        public HybridFileSelectButton(@NonNull
                              android.widget.RelativeLayout view,
                              @Nullable
                              java.lang.String desc,
                              @Nullable
                              android.graphics.drawable.Drawable icon,
                              @Nullable
                              java.lang.String settingID,
                              java.lang.String requestText,
                              @Nullable
                              java.io.File initialState,
                              @NonNull
                              java.io.File rootDir)
        A variant of the HybridSettingsButton, this allows a user to select a file from the Android filesystem, and displays whether or not said value has been set yet.
        Parameters:
        view - the Hybrid Button XML element to link this object to. Cannot be null. The Context being used by this element will be used to derive such things as colors, preset Strings, and element unit IDs. This context is not cached for future use.
        desc - The text to show on the button. Setting this to null will default it to 'Button'.
        icon - The Drawable reference to set this button's icon to. Setting this to null will default it to the Android 'New Folder' icon.
        requestText - the text that the button should display in the prompt for file selection
        initialState - the File that the button should store as its initial internal state. Useful if the program using the button needs to preset the value to a default, previously set value, or something similar. This value will also be used as the initial default state.
        settingID - the SettingsManager Setting ID to use for processing output. Setting this to null will cause interaction handling to update only the internal state variable, and not the settings index.
        rootDir - the root directory to use when loading the file list. null or invalid values will result in an IllegalArgumentException.

    • Method Detail

      • handleInteract

        public void handleInteract(SettingsManager manager)
        Handles an interact request for this button object. In this case, the button will display a dialog asking the user to select a file in the Android filesystem, with prompt text specified in this object's internal variables. Automatically updates the button's appearance and stored state when finished.
        Specified by:
        handleInteract in class HybridSettingsButton
        Parameters:
        manager - the SettingsManager object to deliver the result file to. If null, this object will skip result delivery and simply update its internal state.
        See Also:
        HybridSettingsButton.handleInteract()

      • getState

        public java.io.File getState()
        Gets this button's internal stored state.
        Returns:
        the File that this object is storing as its state

      • setState

        public void setState(java.io.File state)
        Sets this button's stored state. This determines the button's displayed state, as well as how it handles return values from interact requests.
        Parameters:
        state - the File that this button should store as its internal state

      • getRootDir

        public java.io.File getRootDir()
        Gets the current root directory used by this button's file select mechanism.
        Returns:
        a File representing the current root directory

      • setRootDir

        public void setRootDir(java.io.File rootDir)
        Sets this button's file select root directory.
        Parameters:
        rootDir - the root directory to use when loading the file list. null or invalid values will result in an exception.

      • getRequestText

        public java.lang.String getRequestText()
        Gets the text that this button is currently using for file select prompting.
        Returns:
        the text that displays when this object is requested to handle file interaction

      • setRequestText

        public void setRequestText(java.lang.String requestText)
        Sets the text that this button displays in its file select dialog when it is requested to handle interaction.
        Parameters:
        requestText - the text that this object should use for file select interaction handling. Setting this to null will use the default text for this object subtype, specified in strings.xml.

      • updateLinkedView

        public void updateLinkedView()
        Description copied from class: HybridSettingsButton
        Updates this object's linked View object with this object's current icon and description.

        updateLinkedView in class HybridSettingsButton

      • setDefaultState

        public void setDefaultState(java.io.File defaultState)
        Sets the default state of this object to the specified File. By default, null is used as the default state.
        Parameters:
        defaultState - the File to use as this object's default state

      • loadDefaultState

        public void loadDefaultState(SettingsManager manager)
        Description copied from class: HybridSettingsButton
        Resets this button to its default state. The default state may be specified manually with the setDefault method (implemented by subclasses). This only loads default settings for the stored data state of the object, and not its appearance.
        Specified by:
        loadDefaultState in class HybridSettingsButton
        Parameters:
        manager - the SettingsManager object to push the updated state to. If null, this object will skip pushing the new state and simply update its internal value.
        See Also:
        HybridSettingsButton.loadDefaultState()
